qas.question: Disney and Comcast joined forces to allow Comcast to air what sports networks?
What network was proposed by Comcast and the US Olympic Committee?
What city hosted the 2010 Winter Olympics?
What happened to the U.S. Olympic Network?

answers.text: The U.S. Olympic Committee and Comcast have ended the plans

qas.question: Which ESPN channels are unavailable for Comcast?
When did the Olympic Committee and Comcast officially launch their combined network?
What city is the US Olympic Committee located?
What did Comcast put on hold?
When did Comcast and Disney reach an agreement?

context: Comcast delivers third-party television programming content to its own customers, and also produces its own first-party content both for subscribers and customers of other competing television services. Fully or partially owned Comcast programming includes Comcast Newsmakers, Comcast Network, Comcast SportsNet, SportsNet New York, MLB Network, Comcast Sports Southeast/Charter Sports Southeast, NBC Sports Network, The Golf Channel, AZN Television, and FEARnet. On <b8_0>May 19, 2009<b8_0/>, Disney and ESPN announced an agreement to allow Comcast Corporation to carry the channels <a0_0><b4_0>ESPNU and ESPN3<b4_0/><a0_0/>. The U.S. Olympic Committee and Comcast intended to team up to create <a1_0><b7_0>The U.S. Olympic Network<b7_0/><a1_0/>, which was slated to launch <b5_0>after the 2010 <a2_0><b6_0>Vancouver<b6_0/><a2_0/> Olympic Games<b5_0/>. These plans were then put on hold by the U.S. Olympic Committee. <a3_0>The U.S. Olympic Committee and Comcast have ended the plans<a3_0/> to create The U.S. Olympic Network.
